title: Complicated but great once you know how!
comment: The form is very straightforward to build and gives you a lot of flexibility to design something as simple or as complex as you want in excel. Including photos and switching languages is superduper easy both in creation and usage stages!The upload /download process is a bit trickier but once i had the workflow worked out it works like a charm!  Also must add that they have really excellent support service in the odk forum with fast and detailed solutions to any issues.

title: Search in preloaded CSV
comment: Search criteria: "search(csvName, 'startswith', columnsToSearch, searchText)" does not work. Show an error 'syntax error in search() function:....'.

title: Frustrating
comment: I used to use OKD about two years ago and it was okay then. Now though, using the very same forms I used before, I am presented with errors. Now I don't know whether it is Google Appspot or something else, but I cannot use it any longer due to form submission errors.  Also, the Google Drive option allows me to download an XML form from drive and use it but, I cannot submit it. It seems it is not even supported.  You are supposed to make using your application easier as it matures, not complicate it.

Please go to our website, and our Google group for assistance.

It is likely that your server installation is vastly out-of-date; if you are trying to use the newest features, your server needs to be upgraded; older servers cannot support newer features.

title: In need of a facelift
comment: Looking to use for natural disasters. 1)The interface is basic. 2)I need to enter my observations and can not- Standardized categories 3) geotagging photos is a sep form, 4) forestry - tree lists too long 5) Plot type - no  description headings. My search continues.

You have to design your own form that captures the data you need. The included forms are just examples that demonstrate some of the capabilities of the tool. Go to http://opendatakit.org to learn how to design your own forms.

title: No Menu button
comment: There is no Menu button to get to Server Preferences, so that you can change servers. Therefore, this app is worthless.

title: Excellent tool...

The software is maintained by an open-source development community. Code contributions are welcome. Go to http://opendatakit.org/ to begin contributing to this community effort.

title: Nice job!
comment: Excellent data collection..if possible please change the location system using mobile GPS..not every place can receive network..

There is a device setting for this. 

Open your device's Settings app, choose 'Location Services' and check both 'Google's location service' and 'GPS'.  The location service uses wifi hotspots and cellular tower data to return an estimated geo-location, a method that works indoors where GPS signals typically do not reach.
